item.name: 12 Days
item.comment: Light trick taking game that is fast enough to not outlast the playtime.

item.name: 15 Dias: The Spanish Golden Age
item.comment:
Obviously I don't understand this one at all, because there are a lot of very positive reactions posted here.
The art is very distracting and obscures the icons, the icons themselves are far too similar to differentiate casually from across the table making difficult to understand what your opponents are doing unless they say so out loud.
The power struggle between each character seems anti-climactic leading me to believe that I'm missing something, but the rulebook is in such a tiny font that I can bearly read it. If this catches fire in the US maybe someone can get me over my sense of being underwhelmed.

item.name: 1830: Railways & Robber Barons
item.comment:
great game with a lot of group control of the pace. the stock chart is dizzying at times, but the underlying concepts of the profitablity vs. the viability of a company adds strees to the puzzle on the route building phases.
I don't know how often I will play due to the grind out of gutting the Bank, but it's a really good game.

item.name: 1944: Race to the Rhine
item.comment: An impulse purchase based on the design coming out of Poland.

item.name: 1989: Dawn of Freedom
item.comment:
Spot on themes and mechanics; however, I find this to be an odd game that is hard to like. Unlike a lot of other asymmetrical CDGs that I enjoy (Hannibal and Sword of Rome) this game tilts towards one side (Communists) and is then landslide for the other side (Democrats).
The overall feeling is that if the Communist player is not firmly in the lead by the mid period, just concede and try again or play something else.

item.name: 1st & Goal
item.comment:
A fun dice game with a bucketload of expansion pack featuring teams of wildly varying skills. The play decks are the same each time, but the yardage comparisons on each dice are different once you abandon the generic dice in the base set.
On my first few plays I was pleased to see that there is much more than pure luck during the play calling. The strategy of american football is there in a simple fun way.

item.name: 2 de Mayo
item.comment: solid fun and clever mix of hidden orders and abstract warfare, an excellent game.

item.name: 2019: The ARCTIC
item.comment:
really clever near future struggle for limited resources with politics, influence, money and combat.
the board is abstract and hypnotic.

item.name: 404: Law Not Found
item.comment:
Hilarious concept; well played, Sir!
Unfortunately, I really don't enjoy programming games
item.wishlistcomment: Isaac would be proud...

item.name: 51st State
item.comment: nothing memorable dispite being associated with the Neuroshima setting. Not as "meh" as Race for the Galaxy, but very tame for a "Mad Max" theme...blech.

item.name: 6 nimmt! Jubil√§umsedition
item.comment: A fun card game for groups of all sizes, fast playing with tactics and a sense of humor as the game can swing wildly against you if players are actively attacking.

item.name: 7 Days of Westerplatte
item.comment: One of the many excellent design from Poland this year
item.wishlistcomment: Really interested in this coop wargame, another notable game from Poland

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: great drafting game with a civ tech tree theme that works well with any number of players. excellent filler.

item.name: A las Barricadas! (2nd Edition)
item.comment:
SCW game I will buy regardless
preordered april 2014
Received 9/12/15, punched and sorted...love the new edition and the treatment of each faction.
item.wishlistcomment:
I'm curious about SCW games in general and this one in particular.
Available for preorder

item.name: Abyss
item.comment: Nice art and components. Very subject to luck of the draw & turn order. The character powers are varied and interesting, but I got bored by the end of each game.

item.name: Acquire
item.comment: A classic game that I could happily play or not play.

item.name: Ad Astra
item.comment: Interesting and seriously pretty. Not sure how often we'll play, but I enjoy the settlers aspect without the robber and the race for resources without conflict...which is odd since I love conflict games...

item.name: Adeptus Titanicus
item.comment: important because this is where Epic came from, not a game worth revisiting.

item.name: Adeptus Titanicus II
item.comment: horrible update to Titan Legions, not near worth the effort to read or play

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: A silly mess of plastic and indiana jones. We'll all forget about this soon enough and go back to the movies.

item.name: Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant
item.comment: A fun risk management gave that is lighter than many other MW games, but with enough players the decisions are interesting. IMO this games shines with 5; it seems you should removed a portion of the tiles if you have fewer players, otherwise the game seems to ground to a halt as meaningful choices fade leaving the ending kinda flat.
item.wishlistcomment: waiting for May...impatiently?...now sadly, I await September...*sigh*

item.name: After the Flood
item.comment:
multiple resources, playing as the residents of Sumer as well as would be conquerors, limited actions, variable turn order, EXCELLENT!
copy #281!

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
item.comment: An ok game, I certainly can't turn my nose at the quality of the production, but I found myself wishing the game had more tension and drama, like Struggle of Empires. The end result is a lengthy set of action selection and resolution steps that detract from the visual appeal and the excitement of the era.

item.name: Age of Gods
item.comment: a very mean game, with fantasy races as disposable playthings...reminds me of small world...the scaling of the races is very cool, as are their abilities. the turn structure is neat, but there seems to be a problem with the predictability of favored races when you max out the players.

item.name: Age of Industry
item.comment: A variation on the mechanics of Brass with a lot less fiddly theme elements. The multiple maps are a plus, but I think I like Brass a little more for the tight intergration of theme and mechanics

item.name: Age of Renaissance
item.comment: This game seems very rinse-wash-repeat and you'd think that over the length you'd be bored, but that's not the case at all. The event deck and the sequence of each turn has tension and timing that is dramatic and engaging. The turn initiative has unique positive and negative attributes. The synergy of the tech tree takes a while to comprehend. A great game.

item.name: Age of War
item.comment:
Fun reimplementation of Risk Express, but suffers from certain player counts. Probable most fun with 3 or maybe 4 players, terrible with 2, 5 and 6
Losing a die to keep rolling is significantly more interesting than 3 three times.

item.name: Agent Hunter
item.comment:
It's painlessly quick and equally forgettable,
The bluff element is superseded by luck and inducing the hidden cards. There are just too few variables.

item.name: Air Baron
item.comment:
far too much randomness for my current tastes (11/11) and the ever increasing number of chits in the cup make the game seem to drag as luck comes home to roost...strategy died along with my interest as 3 of 5 players were passivly watching the other 2 get endless draws while we starved.
Blech.

item.name: Airlines Europe
item.comment:
A contest of routebuilding and out collecting majority presence in 11 stock choices. After playing Chicago Express I find it odd that the stocks, the dividends and the routebuilding are completely disconnected; call it personal expectations.
The game is very pretty, and the gameplay is mostly smooth...the scoring is a tad overlong.
Given Ticket to Ride and this I'd choose this one.

item.name: Alba Longa
item.comment:
I like the idea of this game and the theme...worker placement with combat.
Given the theme, a simple point race without warfare it would be a failure, but by engaging the theme it separates itself from what makes worker placement popular - the lack of direct conflict.
Worker placement's sweet spot is in passive aggressive abstract conflict. As god as this seems it fails to capture the attention of the worker placement crowd.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: I can see the appeal and I got the gameplay quite easily, but this is not engaging to me...very pretty solo Carcassone

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment:
great new version of dice-festing, after years of crying YAHTZEE! now I have a thematic basis for rejoicing.
The game is not a heavy-weight by any means but the artwork and components give it that certain "I don't know what"

item.name: American Carrom
item.comment: A great summer time experience in East Syracuse as a child. No copy of this ever found its way into my home, but it did prepare me for pool and it's variants like Crokinole

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: great bidding game, with theme and other mechanics blending into a classic...still like Ra better.

item.name: Anachronism
item.comment: This game was possibly my most disappointing game experience ever. My friend at History channel hyped it, I bought it. Loved the cards, grit my teeth reading the rules, and played it in a few bitterly resented minutes. There are so many better single unit gladiator-themed games. This is the only game I have ever thrown in the trash in disgust. In retrospect my original rating of 3 was overly kind...

item.name: Andean Abyss
item.comment:
A game that requires repeat plays. The card deck system is superior to Labyrinth because there is no hand management. The strategy of the first players action demands your full attention.
Really want to play it again.

item.name: Android
item.comment: This is either very innovative and brilliant, or a hot mess that will fade and blossom much later. Regardless there is nothing like it in my collection. Someday I will understand it all and it will hold regard like Magic Realm and Mage Knight.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment:
Initial plays were awesome! I'd love to see how far you can explore on just the starter set...
Bulked out my set with 2 add'l core sets for 6 player drafting set up.

item.name: Angola
item.comment:
A cluster-fuck fur-ball with tough choices and uncertain outcomes, but many opportunities for cooperative team play and lines of control.
I'd love to play this again as I love the asymmetrical player powers. I often get fascinated by asymmetry in games, especially wargames. The action selection decks are very cool.
It's one downside is it is a long game...

item.name: Anima Tactics
item.comment:
Loving the system and minatures. The deep void left by Rackham is being filled!
After a large number of plays I am less enthused by the amount of grind that occurs during combat. The mnis are indeed some of the best ever, but the game tends to drag.

item.name: Antiquity
item.comment:
A euro puzzle with fiddly counters mechanics that would flummox any hex and counter junkie!
Regardless the game is as solid as a rock with cause and effect chains that require a ton of management, upkeep and strategy. I don't think this is a game I'd play but once a year, however I see why it's so well regarded.

item.name: Anzio
item.comment: An older wargame that is of interest for both its history and design.

item.name: Arcana
item.comment:
owned for the Cadwallon art, the game is ok.
My opinion of the revised edition is much higher...

item.name: Arcana
item.comment:
greaty improved with better art, more options and unique factions, as well as more logical iconography.
Now this game stands as a upper-tier example of a deck-building game that is much different than Dominion. The bidding competition is interactive without being destructive.

item.name: Arcane Legions
item.comment:
Played several rounds with the demo units. Too early to say more than the system has a lot of promise and the regroup rules are solid.
One note that had me bothered since I saw the videos and played it myself...Ranged Attacks are DEVASTATING. Terrain will tone it down, but at the expense of Maneuverability.
I am interested to see how this develops.
Even knowing how nasty the Han Dynasty "bow hunting skills" are I bought Romans...we'll see how this goes...
The verdict is in! after less than one year this game is on life support waiting for someone to pull the plug...I went one step further and tossed mine in the garbage, very cathartic and satisfying.
item.conditiontext:
Roman Faction, all figures trimmed and assembled:
Set includes: Roman demo - 5 unit cards 8 Minotaurs, 5 command figures, 5 heavy infantry, Complete booster set (62 painted figures and 47 unit cards) 6 packs of Infanty (240 figures, 20 unit cards) 4 packs of Cavalry (56 figures, 15 unit cards) 2 turning keys, 38 large bases, 29 small bases and 3 score cards 1 league booster pack (4 painted figures, 1 flag, 3 unit cards and 1 scoring card)

item.name: Arctic Scavengers
item.comment: Enjoyable deck builder with a competitive test at the end round, you need to divide your focus into several areas to keep in the hunt for the victory. Not a game to play regularly, but worth trying.

item.name: Are You A Werewolf?
item.comment: Amusing social game undone by its length and player elimination. Regardless it is a game that is worth playing. I think experiencing this is essential, if only as a paradigm for comparing other deduction games.

item.name: Aristo-Maze
item.comment:
Auction for support heroes with special abilities, push your luck through a series of cards, score points. A dungeon crawl without the dungeon, the story or a sense of adventure.
A playable game that I see no reason to play.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: this game should be a favorite based on theme and design, but somehow I can't get a grasp on the fun. Everytime we play this fails to excite. We replayed several times thinking we were missing something. In the end we won't be playing this in the near future.

item.name: Arkwright
item.comment: Spreadsheet game, but supposedly worth the play length

item.name: Article 27: The UN Security Council Game
item.comment: Great voting mechanics, the discs give you your tactical motivations and your agenda frames your strategy. How you manipulate your opponents is an entirely different matter. Great freedom in the exploration of the means and methods.

item.name: Artifact
item.comment:
An extremely tedious amount of work to score points for set collection. The components are ridiculously poor in design.
This is the most complicated version of Ticket to Ride I have played to date...Play anything else and be glad.

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment:
I like the mechanics and the strategies...I hate the quality of the tiles. That's a deal-breaker in a dexterity game. The abstraction of temporal rifts or whatever is inexcusable.
If the tiles laid flat (without assistance) and did not fray at the puzzle joints so easily, this would be a superior 4x game, as it it is a good idea undone by poor quality components.

item.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer
item.comment: an entertaining deck-building game that is interesting due to limited access to card effects via a small card set and combined point scoring as the game ending condition. keeps the game short which in fact was the original appeal of this genre.

item.name: Ascension: Return of the Fallen
item.comment:
Great solo and better add on to the original game. allows for 6 players without bogging down.
After "A Few Acres of Snow" this is my Deck-builder game.

item.name: Ascension: Storm of Souls
item.comment: Third Set in the Series. Seems to carry forward with a few changes without losing the essential nature of what makes Ascension enjoyable. nice shift in card art.

item.name: Assault on Doomrock
item.comment:
Truely difficult, maybe impossibly hard co-op. I like dicing for abilities each round, but the end of section "boss" encounters are very fiddly and procedural, not to mention insanely hard as the monsters get tougher as their numbers dwindle (the "frenzy" rule).
Awesomely overproduced with tons of stuff, but if offered a choice I'd pick Runebound over this.
FYI - I don't enjoy most cooperative games.

item.name: AT-43 Initiation Set: Operation Damocles
item.comment:
Operation Damocles is a fine beginning and probably the shortest, most well-thought through minatures rulebook I have seen in a long time. The basic rules take 5 minutes, with each scenario adding to the depth. By the end of it's 24 pages you've spent 3 or four hours and you're ready to fight with all the rules!
Among the pre-painted miniatures crowd this is level of quality is unprecedented! Many of us will be touching them up, but they are so well done, it is only my own vainty that compels me.
Follow-up play with the full ruleset and army books has led me to conclude that this game is not quite what I was hoping for. I like the universal table, but used as intended, the weapon ranges reward static game play.
The Therian LP routines allow for ridiculous abilities to be utilized and the UNA "medic" ability only intensifies the feeling that even during the design and playtesting it was quite appearant that something wasn't working.
I am not giving up on this game, but I am struggling to endorse the system.
the system continues to elude the fun factor. Whatever the reason, my affair with this game is nearly done.
The inconsistant fiction makes this even more pathetic, can't even try to fool myself into thinking this universe is cool...and the Karman previews going around are worse than the crap they showed in the main rulebook. Based on what I have sunk into AT-43, this is becoming my worst gaming debacle of all time. And I was so happy with it back in December 06...
that's it I'm done...this was heartbreaking.
item.conditiontext: Stuff available for whole lot or partial trades: AT-43 ‚Äì Core rulebook, Damocles Starter Book, 2 Maps sheets, 7 Cry Havoc cards and 3 player aid cards Therians ‚Äì 65 cards, 3 vehicles, 71 miniatures Bane Goliaths (3) repainted Bane Goliaths (3) Incubus Golgoth Poltergeist Golgoth Wraith Golgoth (red) Storm Golem (18) Storm Golem (11) repainted Storm Golem w/Sonic Gun (12) Storm Golem w/Sonic Gun (4) repainted Storm Golem w/Flamer (5) Storm Golem w/Flamer repainted Storm Golem Leader (3) Assault Golem (8) Assault Golem (5) repainted Assault Golem w/Nucleus Gun Assault Golem w/Nucleus Gun repainted Atis-Astarte character Urash character Assault Medusa (3) Assault Medusa w/Nucleus Gun UNA ‚Äì 64 cards, 5 vehicles, 68 figures, Fire Toad Strider (5) w/an extra pair of machine guns and grenade launchers White Stars troopers (12) White Stars Specialists (14; 2 sgt, 2 demolitionist, 2 medic, 2 flamer, 4 machine gun, 2 missile launcher ) Steel Troopers (21) Steel Trooper Specialists (20; 4 Sgt, 2 Mechanics, 2 medics, 8 missile launchers, 2 laser guns, 2 Machine Guns) Captain Newton Red Blok ‚Äì 60 cards, 1 vehicle, 47 miniatures Urod Strider RPG Kolossus (3) RPG soldiers (5) Grenade Launcher soldier Mechanic soldier SMG troopers (8, incl sgt) SMG medics (2) Speznatz troopers (3; sgt, demolitionist, medic) Dragonov Troopers (10) Dragonov Snipers (6) Dragonov Specialists (8; 2 sgt, 2, gauss gun, 2 ECM, 2 medics) if it peaks your interest, I have the AT-43 Tactics book too. Lots of Therians, lots of Steel Troopers, some Star Troopers, some Red Blok. I'm looking to send you everything...,surprise me with an offer!

item.name: Attack of the Mutants!
item.comment: Vague, but fond memories of the free version when I was a teen.

item.name: Attack of the Mutants!
item.comment: Having enjoyed the promo version, I really like the Album format; i never owned a copy in the day. The bigger map, more of everything and the thick counters make this a great collectors item... as fun as the child in me remembered.

item.name: Augustus
item.comment: Dull game that looks nice, but very light and not in my wheelhouse.

item.name: Automobile
item.comment: An awesome economic game that is different and engaging with the number of players. I really prefer the wood pieces and art of the treefrog edition.

item.name: Ave Caesar
item.comment: Highly regarded race game, great screwage game with large groups

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment:
comical and challenging in equal measure, this game has aged well and finally gotten a production value worthy of it. Great Price, excellent game play.
A True Classic!

item.name: Axis & Allies 1941
item.comment: This stripped down version is what I was looking for as an entry point into the hobby for non-war gamers and my wife, a Risk fan. The unit density and play time are spot on as a way to get you started and leads you straight towards the next level of strategic play. "Training wheels for Wargaming" excellent job

item.name: Axis & Allies Anniversary Edition
item.comment:
Wow this thing is nice! A & A on a grand scale. Fun to play, much better than the standard game, but definitely eclipsed by the 1940 edition.
As for gameplay, it can be a long game unless folks are willing to concede and play again or something else.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Europe
item.comment: I found this very easy to stalemate in and never found the key to breaking it....we both conceded.

item.name: Axis & Allies: WWI 1914
item.comment: I have misgivings about the A&A system strapped over this conflict, but it looks good...seems a shame that the initial reactions center around insufficient components.
item.wishlistcomment: CP & A? CPA?? Before there was an Axis to Ally against??? I gotta see what this is!

item.name: Aye, Dark Overlord!
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
a fun silly game that rewards absurdity and lying.

item.name: Babel
item.comment: New printing, time to seriously debate getting this...

item.name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: Core Sets
item.comment: We always seem to get to a static position where no one player is wiling to expose themselves. There is a moment of alliance followed by invasion and sudden betrayal...then back to a stand-off. Very thematic to play, but very long if you play with crafty people.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment:
Wife's
a classic game that is a must for any gamer, best mix of suede, cordrouy felt and leather ever.

item.name: The Bagged Peiper
item.comment: Their Postcard games are uniformly awful

item.name: Bamboleo
item.comment: A fun party game with wood shapes of various sizes and deceptively variable weight, the method you choose to pluck pieces off the table is key to success. If you have a steady hand and patience you will get a lot out of this, the impulsive will get frustrated quickly.

item.name: Banana Party
item.comment: A bizarre title you can't say with a straight face and something you should never ask a child to play. The game is as unfun as you can imagine. Monkeys on dowels wait to tumble behind a screen. Pick a dowel turn and see if a monkey was hanging on it...that's about it.

item.name: Band of Brothers: Ghost Panzer
item.comment: fascinating mix of streamlining and chrome in a squad level tactical wargame. This series seems to be well developed, supported and very playable to a dullard like me.

item.name: Band of Brothers: Screaming Eagles
item.comment: Totally overcome by the hype of other gamers...I'm hopeless.
item.wishlistcomment: Waiting on a possible 2nd printing.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: high degree of fun and uncertainty. it was an instant hit with everyone! people were in line to play!

item.name: BANG! The Bullet!
item.comment:
A complete set of the Bang! series, packed in a overly large self-pleasuring device, how could anyone pass that up?
Mild shame about the english only cards, as my crew thought they were learning Italian each session!
item.conditiontext: all cards sleeved

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment:
Meh...I don't find this remotely entertaining, except for the dice rolling, but if given a chance I'd play King of Tokyo if I need a Yahtzee variant.
It makes Bang! faster by removing the strategy (hand management). Sad.

item.name: Barbarian Prince
item.comment:
excellent solo gameplay from a time before online and PBEM gaming.
Dated gae that is not worth collecting. Try Mage Knight for the same price.

item.name: Barrel of Monkeys
item.comment:
a dexterity game even a chimp can play! :P
The challenge for me was fitting the goddamned dirty apes back in the barrel after playing.
Stupid, but essential for a child of the 70's

item.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045
item.comment:
Intersting use of deck building with full use of card text.
Plays smoothly with interesting consequences for successive turns over the match. I wish the art was more prominent on the cards, but it doesn't detract.

item.name: Battle for Armageddon
item.comment:
at least it is free now...
Overproduced attempt at a wargame by GW. Not worth tracking down or printing.

item.name: Battle for Baghdad
item.comment:
I give full credit for the production choices and the theme adaptation of Dune; in the end it is a better fit than the FFG production of Rexx.
Unfortunately the rules and FAQ lead me to believe that there was a sense of wearyness during the development and the end result is weak. After acknowledging that there are some "artifacts" that are confusing, where is the corrected PDF of the rules?
If the designers no longer care enough to tend to their design, why should a set of players slog through this version?
Back to Arrakis...

item.name: Battle for Germany
item.comment: Interested in the game mechanics

item.name: Battle for Stalingrad
item.comment: Reasonably fun card game with the opportunity for a lot of interaction. Unfortunately the game is marred by vague rules and wording on timing of card plays and seemingly obvious interactions (can you interrupt an interrupt?). Worse still these question appear to have gone unanswered by the designer in play testing and in this community.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: I bought this cold, based on all of the BGG feedback. I was not disappointed. this game is so simple...to learn! Once you get into it the complexity and agony of choice kicks in and then you are hooked. Great fun with friends.

item.name: The Battle of Five Armies
item.comment: Debatable if I need WotR and this...

item.name: The Battle of Stalingrad
item.comment:
Honeymoon option...will I be won over to buy the whole set?
turgid game with only the mounted map as the good bit.

item.name: The Battle of Tours, 732 A.D.
item.comment:
Honeymoon option...will I be won over to buy the whole set?
Holy Shit what a Richard Berg Turd

item.name: Battlefleet Gothic
item.comment:
played it after I had tried Full Thrust. FT wins hands down. However, the minis for this line are beautiful.
I disposed of the rules somewhere along the way.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment:
More of the C and C system. The minis are terrible. I prefer the Ancients blocks and stickers.
I traded this for Combat Commander: Mediterranean the same night I bought C&C:A exp. 2 and 3. Happy me!

item.name: BattleLore (Second Edition)
item.comment: Re-themed around the Terrinoth realm. Greatly improved gameplay with excellent oversized miniatures. It's certainly inferior to C & C: Ancients, but for fantasy fans and FFG fanatics this is a great edition. Well worth your time playing regardless of preferences.

item.name: Battleship
item.comment:
Wife's
not a game i enjoy, but everybody knows this one by heart right?

item.name: Battleship Card Game
item.comment:
Surprisingly pleasant game that I would happily ignore or play as filler. The duel abilities and mix of cards is deep enough to allow for multiple plays. He think I liked the least was the acceleration of the endgame.
I must it admit it was more fun than I would have assumed.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: I'll take the fun of role-play lite BSG drama over other co-ops with a collection of mechanisms and bare-bones traitor abilities.

item.name: Battlestations
item.comment: Very interested...but alas i haven't the time or the interest to play in a sandbox universe.

item.name: Battlesuit
item.comment:
overplayed tedium from the OGREverse. not even worth having as a space waster.
After careful consideration I choose the extra space over keeping this turd.

item.name: BattleTech
item.comment:
excellent to play, just too few people to play it with. one of the best Sci-fi settings, especially pre-clan. Star League mechs are my favorite models.
Recently, I found a group of dedicated players that were happy to adopt my collection. I wish them many hours of fun. (*sob*)

item.name: BattleTech CCG
item.comment: another monkey that failed to mount me...bleech

item.name: Battling Tops
item.comment: I used to just stare at the patterns generated during the spinning of the tops...very funny event at BGG.con.

item.name: Bausack: Sac Noir
item.comment: Fun, but frustrating game. You really need a stable surface to enjoy this properly. Happy to play anytime.

item.name: Bermuda Triangle
item.comment:
that cloud was cool as it sucked in ships, but what a random mess, no strategy, just cool factor.
oh, the 70's such a horrible decade for almost everything...

item.name: Between Two Cities
item.comment:
Pleasant and short with 3, but rather empty as two of the players are at the whim of one player who is stacking one board, especially if the other two are balancing their plays.
It's probably best with a large number of players allowing for more variables with regard to available tiles as the draft cycles.

item.name: Biblios
item.comment:
played a few rounds of this and i have a fine time, its very light for my tastes, but i like the card counting and push your luck elements. the auction round is fun as well.
i did find it a bit obvious what to go for and what to poison, but that didn't make it any less pleasant.
i think this makes for a good, but not excellent filler.

item.name: Big City
item.comment: fun with fewer people (3?) I love the look and simplicity, but I am unsure about the strategy. sooner or later there always seems to be a runaway leader...would I play this at all if the pieces were chits?

item.name: The Big Time!
item.comment:
Played at BGGcon, really easy to learn and the strategy blossoms inside of the second round. Plenty of positioning and herding your opponents into tough decisions.
Worthy of a publishers attention!
item.wishlistcomment: Looking forward to the published edition. Well developed game.

item.name: Bingo
item.comment: A popular way to follow direction, react quickly, and argue over victory conditions without actually making any decision...is it a game? I bow to the multitude of players, but hope I don't end up among them

item.name: Bitin' Off Hedz
item.comment: in short, this game is a dumpster denizen, but it was worth one drunken play. Overall I don't miss any of the Cheapass line games, but I applaud the creativity of the author later in his career.

item.name: Black & White
item.comment: The rules are poorly translating creating a level of complexity that is unfortunate. I like the stark look and the components are really nice...but I'm probably going to pass on this.

item.name: Black Gold
item.comment:
great update / translation of Giganten. The board sections add a lot of value, but are not as pretty as the original board design...so pleased to have both!
With this version, you have a lot of options, you can even use the original board.

item.name: Black Spy
item.comment:
Enjoyable variation on Hearts with a 5th suit of point cards and a twist allowing the play of same suit or matching the lead card rank. Strategies require adjustments to standard Hearts trick-taking...seems like "shooting the moon" in this game is near impossible.
Additionally the scoring can throw you off at first, but you'll adjust.
My copy came with coasters...LoL WtF

item.name: Blackjack
item.comment: I still don't understand the rhythm of casino play, but I still play it occassionally.

item.name: Blockade Runner
item.comment:
my first look at a pick up and deliver with a combat element...well, let's be honest, it's more about running and surviving combat while gathering cash as fast as you can.
Great art and theme. Very unique...Numbskull seems to excel at esoteric and seductive themes.

item.name: Blood Bowl (Third Edition)
item.comment: it was a fun, but short love affair. This one has lots of devotees, however this could never keep my interest.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Living Rulebook
item.comment: closer but, the skill system strips out the fun after 3 career games

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager ‚Äì The Card Game
item.comment:
unfun at more than 2. the card play and mechanics are ok, but I felt the same sense of dread as when playing bloodbowl...3 games into a season and the upgrades drag the game into the toilet.
with 2 players at least there is some sense of a strategy...with more it devolves into vindictive pile-on and sneaky bullshit.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: good and fast gameplay. not to mention that with no collectability aspect the cost factor for an addict such as myself just right.
item.conditiontext:
generous trade offer includes:
base game (Hoax/Vulca) Flit Mimix Terrah Blessings Buka Pirates

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment: A Knizia game with excellent pace. There is no conflict between players, but a great race to the top with neat card tricks leads to an entertaining session. Highly recommended.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Fun even in large groups, seems like card holders are in order as twitchy people sometimes have a hard time keeping their hand in order. Themeless but the trading is lively.

item.name: Bonaparte at Marengo
item.comment: Not knowing if a second diction will be forthcoming I snapped up this copy, looking forward to gaining more experience
item.wishlistcomment: I'm willing to wait for the 2nd edition...so how long is that?

item.name: The Boss
item.comment: Slight deduction element that is good for light play, not bad by any measure, but not engaging to me.

item.name: Braggart
item.comment: Amusing variation on storytelling, but the card combos and tall tales are basically all stale after the first few plays, not bad when considering the price point, but a game that quickly runs out of steam is not a great game by any measure.

item.name: Brass
item.comment:
The penultimate Wallace game (assuming he has many thrills to come). Tight economy, tighter board and many paths to victory. Amazing intergration of theme and mechanics.
The 2-player mod is fantastic! many thanks to its creator, and all who worked on it.

item.name: Breakout: Normandy
item.comment: A game that is one of the last AH games I must try

item.name: Bretagne
item.comment: A tedious worker placement exercise that reminds me of Snowdonia, but lacks the thematic charm of building something with your opponents. Pretty, but very dull and fiddly.

item.name: Britannia
item.comment:
Really well done as a theme, and a great game with competetive players. That said it is another Risk-like dice game with a long playing time and simple battle mechanics. A very heavy sense of pile-on the leader seems required as each age progresses. The inevitable problem is that one member of the "team" can hold back or conversely get hammered causing acusations of timidness, selfishness or "worm-tongue".
Don't play it with kingmaker, defeatist, or bully personalities.

item.name: Bruges
item.comment:
I think I finally understand the term "point salad" this game is ok but seems dependent on what cards you draw. The dice are not really all that interesting as an random event generator and it goes without saying that the theme is completely disposable.
Light and painless are about the best things I can say.

item.name: The Builders: Middle Ages
item.comment:
Buzz interest, no real feedback yet...
Clean rules and plays fast, just a little to light for long term play, good for fans of short filler games.
item.wishlistcomment: I really like the Timeline series in terms of design and the tin box format. many of the designers other efforts were a miss for me, but this one I hope gets an english release.

item.name: Bullfrog Goldfield
item.comment: A puzzle game with triggers for fixed value stock increases. Interesting exercise but not a game I'm looking to play again anytime soon

item.name: Byzantium
item.comment: neat system that leaves me guessing how to win as both sides? cool level of confusion!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Fun and comical guts game with lots of room for psych-outs and intimidation. You just need to be willing to kill every friend you've ever had.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition)
item.comment:
Is there a difference between the two versions? Dunno, I prefer to cruelty of Mall of Horror...the highlight of this session was a player explaining to his young child why pointing guns at people is bad while continuing to do so...the irony was delightful.
Now if only we could explain Cards Against Humanity...

item.name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves
item.comment: For me this is underwhelming and a waste of great source material. The fact that some early fans of this game are actively discussing it's perceived shortcomings in terms of a fix via an expansion, BEFORE it's release date, defies my understanding.

item.name: California Gold
item.comment: Another cool theme from numbskull
item.wishlistcomment: I'm a fan of Numbskull's design choices, they are a publisher with unique and diverse themes.

item.name: Cambria
item.comment: abstract with dice...meh, I like it on theme, but that is only a placebo for uninspired game play. I looks good for what you pay, but I have more than enough filler games that are far more engaging.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment:
Kayleigh's copy.
Quintessential filler! Accurate game title for the penultimate "press your luck" game. Great fun for those of us who love dice rolling and love watching each other fail!

item.name: Canal Mania
item.comment: fun and not too heavy, a nice change of pace in the typical oh too serious pick up and deliver crowd.

item.name: Candy Land
item.comment: What inevitably happens to every parent and child. Play it, teach them to learn rule structure and move on to a better game

item.name: Captains of Industry
item.comment: Part of a kickstarter for two Michael Keller designs, glad to see this pairing with Tasty Minstrel Games

item.name: Car Wars
item.comment: one of the most beloved (or fondly remembered) SJG games. Not a great game in my estimation, as it takes forever to play and has too much of an RPG taint for my preferences. I can't argue against it too much as it does what it does better than the clones that followed it.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment:
Did not enjoy the tile drawing puzzle elements at all, the scoring even less so; adding in expansions just made it worse. Not my game at all regardless of blood alcohol levels.
The only fun I had with this was deliberately trying to bump on of my friends scores with each play to completely frustrate some "Carca-whore" who started douching at the table about his genius-like knowledge of this drek. He almost started crying when he realized that everyone at the table started piling on just to guarantee we'ed never be asked to play it or him again.
Mission accomplished!

item.name: Cardline: Animals
item.comment: Kayleigh's, another series of games from the Timeline series author...I wish that game was still adding expansions...sigh

item.name: Cardline: Globetrotter
item.comment:
For Kayleigh
Timeline was decidedly better.
item.wishlistcomment: For Kayleigh

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: this game is pathetic and caters to the sick sexuality of people that lack basic social skills. it's embarrassing to watch people string together words into a tapioca of lonely nights masturbating to pictures of NatGeo pygmies.

item.name: Careers
item.comment: probably one of the best strategy games that was part of the mass market, although we wouldn't have known what a strategy game was then. you need the version before the space race for the best experience.

item.name: Carolus Magnus
item.comment: I am having many excellent games recently, but to be sure this in only with the alternate draw pool rules here on BGG. The original dice rules are far less entertaining.

item.name: Carson City
item.comment: another worker placement game that is a nice change in the typically dry mechanic...gunfights, mmmm

item.name: Castellan
item.comment: An abstract with partially randomized resources; hand management is crucial for optimal timing. As a 2-players it is challenging to wait for your big move, but I have no idea how it will play with 3-4.

item.name: Castellan
item.comment: Picked this up for multiplayer sessions, no idea if this one works as a group game.

item.name: Castle Dice
item.comment: Fun dice selection resource engine game, suffers from a lot of randomness that might be fixed by the expansion and it's still too long for its own good, sigh . One and done.

item.name: Caveman Curling
item.comment: Silly fun that is worth a play, I'd always be worried that I'd damage the surface (a rolled mat the could crease) irreparably. Fun, but not a game I'll seek to own.

item.name: Chainmail
item.comment:
light on rules, quick and enjoyable, dice-less card driven tactical game. Fans of miniatures tabletop (skirmish types) and tactical boardgames (Okko/Tannhauser) will feel at home too. Fans of the Command and Colors and Manoeuvre cards systems may also want to give a glance.
Tons of units counters and a multipurpose deck give this game a longer shelf life than the 4 scenarios included. I can easily see the publisher or designer coming up with additional content.
item.conditiontext: counters punched, cards sleeved; in excellent shape

item.name: Chainmail
item.comment:
How many times can Richard Berg sell a weak game system, the world awaits the answer. Happily Richard Berg doesn't give a fuck, so don't feel bad if you hate his designs.
He's the Knizia of wargames (this is an insult)

item.name: Chaos in the Old World
item.comment: Even though the player powers are asymmetric the game is very linear and dissatisfying. Popular by most people's standards, but even as a Warhammer fan I was not engaged. Maybe if the Skaven expansion is really good and not pasted on... Who knows?

item.name: Charades
item.comment: If you've never played this, you have not been to a party hosted by non-gamers. Perhaps the first social game?

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: The basis for my love of abstracts, I do not play it anymore, nor would I suggest it. Regardless I cannot forget the hundreds of times this was played

item.name: Chenghuang: Guardian of the City
item.comment:
Fun card game, but I think you need to play with 4 or more players. With 3 the results seem very easy to predict and force the outcome of each round, making the game a dull process of elimination.
The artwork on the character cards is occasionally edgy (sexy) but not graphic. Regardless the art is excellent.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I'm no chess play, but lord knows I played this for decades.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment:
Wow! This game keeps getting better, tougher and meaner the more you play. Who knew my friends could be so ruthless outside of a wargame?
Excellent.

item.name: China
item.comment: quick and engrossing. well worth playing before or between the big game(s) of the evening.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment: A pure negotiation game, sounds fun

item.name: Chinese Checkers
item.comment: visually lovely, but dull as dirt multiplayer. the version in my house is a collection of wonderful marbles on a wooden board with divots for spaces.

item.name: Chitin: I
item.comment:
Metagaming was an essential part of my childhood.
This game is a combat system part of an RPG that no one seems to remember.

item.name: Christopher Robin's Pooh Goes Home to Bed Game
item.comment: A keepsake for my wife, it's very well done production wise and looks great, but it is very dull roll-and-move. Not painfully as it is a short game to play with your babies.

item.name: Chutes and Ladders
item.comment: classic kids game with all of the novel and exciting mechanisms that make it an activity that someone eventually and quite accidentally wins. The crowd rejoices and then does something meaningful or at least more fun.

item.name: Circvs Maximvs
item.comment: Hilarious old school race game with thrills and spills, very luck dependent and ugly looking, but great fun in a large group.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: this was an automatic hit. not too sure the expansion stuff is worth the inclusion, but the game is solid.

item.name: La Citt√†
item.comment: A classy design with cool components, happy to accidentally obtain a copy...

item.name: City Hall
item.comment:
Kickstarter support for a new and interesting game
Very pleased that TMG picked this up, thank you!
item.wishlistcomment: Very interesting Kickstarter project. 1st crowd funding attempt was a tad short; I hope the author doesn't shelve this design and tries again or seeks other avenues such as partnering with another publisher or design group. This game deserves its shot in the community.

item.name: City of Remnants
item.comment: I really had some hope for the game despite the lackluster miniatures.... but there are disturbing loops in the card mechanics, the police appearing in a bingo-like manner and cockamamy reward chart. very disappointed.

item.name: City Tycoon
item.comment:
It's got a lot going for it, easy to understand icons, synergy between various buildings and phased complexity. The money is tight and managing your portion of the city is a challenge throughout.
I like the power-up mechanism and the scarcity of resources, but in the end it is a victory race; at some point you've got to be focusing on maximizing your VP...oddly enough you don't abandon your less valuable properties - if you planned properly.
The graphics are surreal and very Googie (look it up), but hurt the game, the layout is very consistent and colorblind friendly.

item.name: Clash of Cultures
item.comment: Very enticing and the initial reactions from the first tasters have me very curious!

item.name: Clash of Wills: Shiloh 1862
item.comment:
2nd in the series
Different more desperate fight if the Confederates do well on the 1st day, otherwise it is a grind out with the Union eventually winning the 2nd day. Luck aside it is a historical setup allowing for few mistakes by either side.
item.wishlistcomment: Ok, I admit, I have no clue, but this series of releases deserve a look.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment:
the highlight of Christmas '09! As a dedicated fan of Hybrid I really enjoy Claustrophobia. More so than any other recent tactical board game this one has a lot of tension and desperate situations. Plenty of strategy and a lot of silent pleading for things to break in your favor.
and yes, the components are all excellent.

item.name: Clue
item.comment: The deduction game of childhood, culturally significant, but dated.

item.name: Code 777
item.comment: wild guessing, deductive reasoning - I don't have the knack or draw to this game. the designer's other game Confusion is much more in my wheelhouse. I like the color blind patterning regardless.

item.name: Collateral Damage
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
Anime obsession, fandom material, libido mechanics...hahaha
Thrown away

item.name: Colonial: Europe's Empires Overseas
item.comment: Entertaining to a point, but winning through being pacifist until the final push against a weak navy is a glaring error

item.name: Colonialism
item.comment: Thought provoking theme as you purposefully shoehorn yourself into Africa, Asia and the Far East. Great gameplay through hidden/exposed card play and tooth-and-nail vying for area control with T & E scoring system.

item.name: Colors of Kasane
item.comment:
Wonderful race to score tricks by taking cards without being able to reorder your cards. The gameplay play is very tactical and you need to have a flexible strategy as cards disappear and players claim various tricks.
The production is wonderful with cards representing various patterns and fabrics. The score markers are fabric covered buttons.
Wonderful new game.
item.wishlistcomment: Please see to it that this gets a U.S. publisher

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: this was a 10 for me, but as time marches on I like it a little less, but still a class act.

item.name: Colt Express
item.comment:
Programming action games are just ok in my order of preference. The gimmick of a train does nothing to spur my interest further.
I do like the stacking of the cards as they resolve, but I have no need to play this again.

item.name: Combat Commander: Europe
item.comment:
Meh, concept had me enthused, but the game is chaos incarnate...like a battlefield. Unfortunately the game is long and the chaos is irritating as opposed to invigorating.
I won't miss it.

item.name: Combat Commander: Pacific
item.comment: Better the second time, but I traded it for 3 rare Martin Wallace games. No regrets, but I may buy it again.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment: Having played all of the other C & C variants, I have come to appreciate the depth of play offered by Ancients. The tactics of period and the game system are intergrated in a manner that I felt was lacking somewhat in the other versions. An excellent game accessible to all boardgamers.

item.name: Concentration
item.comment: memory game for the masses, yuck

item.name: Concordia
item.comment:
One of the easiest games to slip into in recent memory, I'm truly impressed at the smooth gameplay. Despite my unwarranted concerns about the themed setting, it's a delight.
Basically you are performing actions, hand management, a little deck building, worker placement, resource investment/production/trading...and yes a personalized rondel (your hand of cards, think Runewars). Add to that your hand is actually a recipe for "point salad", and you'll still be surprised at how charming it is.
And yes, there is luck due to randomized locations, bonuses and a shuffled deck...if only he could've figured out how to add dice and combat :)

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment:
this game has the hallmark of a classic, but is undone by a unbalanced mix of cards. The designer fixed this in another game, Iliad which is similar, but lacks the boardgame aspect.
Condottiere was revamped thru FFG this year (2007), this version seems to have been fixed by the addition of some new cards and a toned-down effect of some others, sadly, for me at least the gameplay is still lacking no matter how many people play.
In contrast, Iliade is still a more engaging version of this system.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Sadly the revamp failed to accomplish anything other than get discarded.

item.name: The Conflict
item.comment:
preordered on 3/1/12...I wonder what the release date will be?
Well...it's been a year and no clue, no announcements, and fleeting hints at this being produced...less expensive than a night in a strip club, but just as hollow and cheap an experience.
2 years today...guess I'm gonna start dating Axis & Allies: 1914 for a taste of dudes on a map WWI-style.
Fuck You Brandon Parsons
Sigh, my second "big" fail after Dice Age.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! ‚Äì Operation Barbarossa 1941 (second edition)
item.originalname: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! (second edition)
item.comment: Prettier and more scenarios...worth getting?

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! ‚Äì Russia 1941-42
item.comment:
a great alternative for people that don't enjoy Combat Commander or ASL, but yearn for a squad-level wargame.
much milder learning curve, great counters.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel! ‚Äì Kursk 1943
item.comment: Fun and fast playing, tank duels over long ranges with deadly point-blank desparation moves by the Russians as the German try to keep the range open without losing initiative.

item.name: Confrontation
item.comment: Having put Hybrid down long enough to get in a few games. I am having a blast! The game goes quickly, requires a lot of strategy and the minatures are outstanding. With 15 armies and numerous variations within each army, the gamer is spoiled shamelessly.

item.name: Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
item.comment: Fascinating mix of abstract and deduction with a beautiful presentation. The dry erase code books make this game a tense and quick play. Another great Stronghold Games production.

item.name: Connect 4
item.comment: one of the earliest non-traditional abstracts I can remember. Tic-tac-toe with gravity. This the grandfather of Tetris and the endless stream of iphone games.

item.name: Conquest of the Empire
item.comment: i'd rather be playing Mare Nostrum...no where near as fun as Stuggle of Empires. Rediculously overproduced.

item.name: Conquest of the Empire
item.comment: the original Master Series game version. a classic game that was fun to play, but has its warts and is definitely improved upon by newer games.

item.name: Container
item.comment:
Shipping commodity game, supposedly excellent, but brittle due to player input?
Many comment about warped boards?

item.name: The Convoy
item.comment: Underwhelming to me when compared to Neuroshima Hex
item.wishlistcomment: clueless, but it comes from the nueroshima theme, need more info...

item.name: Cootie
item.comment:
Hey Ma look! I just built my very first Pubic Lice!
Part of every dopey childhood if you were loved. If you never played this at least now you know that your parents hated you.

item.name: Copper Country
item.comment: Interesting euro game with an industrial theme made easier to play for the lack of an economic component. In the end I enjoyed it. The fact that as a businessman you are rewarded for mercilessly exploiting your workers was fascinating.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment: I need to play this more; I like the overall mechanics, but wish for more interaction than claiming cards first...added in the expansion? Hopefully there is much more here than an homage to RftG with deck building. More plays needed!

item.name: Cornish Smuggler
item.comment: I have no clue, but I love the theme. It's unplayable garbage.

item.name: Corporate America
item.comment: Fun and pointy game of synergy and social manipulation. It pays to grease your opponents, but be careful with who you pay off, anyone of them could be planing your downfall. Getting elected president is very powerful. The essence of pay to play :)

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: This game is relies in the people you play it with...hopefully you play it with people who go out of there way to be sure you understand exactly what their player power does, I invariably end up playing people who think it is cute to keep their knowledge of the game jammed up their butt. As a result I have never had a fun session, hence my low rating.

item.name: Cosmic Wimpout
item.comment: mildly entertaining stoner game.

item.name: Council of Four
item.comment: Desperately dull and under cooked point scoring race. The jockeying of meeples in each section was amusing as the meeples are pushed of the reviewing stands, but that cannot make up for the randomness of the card draws and the crazy values associated by getting somewhere first, or having the "most of" something.

item.name: Countdown: Special Ops
item.comment:
Disappointing is the first reaction, the sterile art loses it's charm and you are left with annoying non-intuitive combat mechanics...the players roll to hit high...and the enemy rolls to hit low...meaning they are more likely to hit. Neat idea for fast action and team play rendered un-fun, by poor design choices and confusing icons.
Terrible

item.name: Coup
item.comment: Great bluffing game. Fast and lots of tension; the very end can be obvious, but getting there is delicious fun.

item.name: Coup d'√©tat
item.comment: Very rare by my standards, a fun trick-taking game with novel scoring board (daggers)

item.name: Coup: Guatemala 1954
item.comment:
A new take on Coup with variable characters to extend replay ability, sobering theme
Sadly I could NEVER get anyone to play this with me...not once.

item.name: Crazy Eights
item.comment: Played by everyone and enjoyed by no one above age 10

item.name: Creatures & Cultists
item.comment:
somewhat funny, but verges on the tedious, after one or two plays the fun starts to elude everyone.
gave it away...

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment: Fun classic that is bet when played on someone else's lovely Hilinski board.

item.name: Crossfire
item.comment: firing ball bearings at each other across a small board...how did we all survive to adulthood? Mankind created this, proof of our genius and dominion over this earth. My finger hurts.

item.name: Crude: The Oil Game
item.comment:
Great commodities game with many strategies and a dose of luck. Reminds me of real life, in that no plan survives contact with things beyond your control, but you can plan better than other people!
A joy to play the Stronghold edition.
item.wishlistcomment: I have no clue, but the look and theme have me hooked.

item.name: Cruel Necessity
item.comment: Solo game ECW

item.name: Crusader Rex
item.comment:
I think the designer is one of the best at historical simulation and the best person to adapt a scenario to the block "fog of war" mechanics.
This game does not entertain me in the slightest; most likely due to the rules and map movement that are necessary parts of the design.
Having admitted that the failure in the game is mine, I removed myself from the equation.
Hammer of the Scots and Richard the III are both "10"

item.name: Cthulhu Dice
item.comment:
a silly game and not worth the cost...neat looking die, but not worth the cost.
There has been a long line of shitty games using Cthulhu as a theme without touching upon the source material in any meaningful way. This one was one of the first. I love SJ games for many reasons and this is not one. I don't think it was a mindless cash grab, but they did maximize the production costs of the custom die by producing endless color variations.
I got this as a gift and I re-gifted it to the trash can.

item.name: Cuba Libre
item.comment: The only COIN game that I have any interest in thematically. I'm glad this also seems to be shorter game too.
item.wishlistcomment: The most interesting topic covered by the COIN system to date (IMO). Having played Andean Abyss, I really look forward to this rendition.

item.name: Cuba: The Splendid Little War
item.comment: VPG deluxe production non-series wargame

item.name: Cubist
item.comment: Dice rolling and pattern building with a get there first race. A fine filler, but not great. Pretty dice regardless.

item.name: Cults Across America
item.comment:
worth a few laughs, but in the end a relatively expensive game that doesn't hold up well or get repeat plays.
banished to the outer realms...

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment:
a game of oneupmanship where you steal each others kills in a dungeon crawl. Totally opportunism and screwage where you jockey to land the killer blow.
it wears thin after one play, but some people can play this happily for hours...I envy that level of satisfaction.

item.name: CV
item.comment:
If I'm gonna play a life and times game I'll take Funny Friends. If I'm gonna play a Yahtzee style game give me King of Tokyo.
The auto locking of cranky faces was annoying.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: I want to like this better than i do so far...the auctions are so far more lackluster than they feel they should be...more plays are needed to answer.

item.name: Czas Honoru: Operacja Most III
item.comment: One of the many Polish designs that have my interest
item.wishlistcomment: A must play this year!

item.name: Danube 20
item.comment: Stand alone Deluxe battle

item.name: Dark Age
item.comment:
I am starting with a St. John warband and a squad of Coils. inital rating on reading 8.5
Bumping to 10
After a few plays this is a exciting tactical game that provides a depth of play and ferocity that is simple to command and taps into a primal need to capitalize on your opponents last success or failure.
Great balance and tight rules, active community and few questions. Add in a low cost to play, and you are set up for a excellent miniatures experience.
after a few years this is fading for me, better than a lot of skirmish games, but still suffers from synergistic rules breakdown. perhaps too many actions per model, maybe it it is the free actions for charging...I've lost my taste for such games.
currently playing at 750 points.
A failed game that Cool Mini or Not tried (or is trying to) resurrect. I am not a painter hobbyist and have no time to bother with this ever again.

item.name: Dark Horse
item.comment:
Entertaining experience, I played a playtest/focus group game and it was gratifying to see our comments had some effects on the final version.
The role cards along with your starting resources help frame your strategy; mixed feeling about that. I wonder if you can change tack and still prevail. A IP/Gold strategy seems to be easily undone by many events and perceived leader bashing while a fortunate diverse mix of resources can only be slowed.
Overall a fun game when people play fast. Hint: moving up in the turn order is very important.

item.name: Dark Minions
item.comment:
theme-less.
A great game if you are a dice whore. I like rolling the bones and trash talk. this game is all about pushing for maximum results and very little strategy.

item.name: Dark Moon
item.comment: Fun, tense and very fast to play. It features the meat of what you love about the hidden traitor game in 2 hours. It doesn't kill BSG, but it may be a preferred alternative to the bloat that is every FFG property

item.name: A Dash of Peiper
item.comment: Bad pun, dumb postcard game, free, given away again

item.name: David & Goliath
item.comment:
I liked the scoring system....but
Game-wise I was disappointed in two rules; off-suit cards are legal "winning" plays and the last card of the same value trumps previously played cards. I'm not sure this is good with 5 players either, but regardless I would play again if only to confirm my ambivalence towards D&G.
I would rather Hearts, Spades, Euchre, M√º, Coup d'√©tat or ANY other trick-taking game.
I do understand that this is intended or pitched as a family game, but all of the previously mentioned games were taught to me by my family, so in context this game pales in comparison.

item.name: Days of Battle: Golan Heights
item.comment:
A great VPG low counter density game set in the Yom Kippur War. Very reminiscent of my plays of the Napoleonic 20 series.
Major differences are unit type initiative order and day/night modifiers.
Worth several plays.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment:
This feels like the errand making scavenger hunt in Shadows Over Camelot and Arkham Horror. The art does nothing for me as I dislike the sterile computerized look of the characters.
I can't say much about the crossroads cards as I have not experience most of them, but I was bored with this coop.

item.name: Deadlands: Doomtown
item.comment: a CCG that earned my contempt and wasted too much of my cash. Yes it was my fault, but I am much better now and I can see the monkey on my back for what it is, OCD not CCG.

item.name: Deadlands: The Great Rail Wars
item.comment: A great minis game that had ok minis, but no support. What a shame. The system lives on as Savage Worlds.

item.name: Deluxe G.E.V.
item.comment:
take a great wargame, make minis, get the fanbase excited and then pull the rug out from us when it doesn't sell fast enough, then go back to making mediocre card games.
thank you SJ games.
in context of the Kickstarter project I still feel justified in my hurt feelings, but I am glad to see the fan base come out swinging, sending OGRE in a new edition.

item.name: Deus
item.comment: Resource engine with area control, kinda ugly art direction IMO, and I feel it is very random due to the common deck. I can't say I really enjoyed it, but I'm glad I played it.

item.name: Devil Bunny Hates the Earth
item.comment: it was a couple of bucks, I was drinking (again) and the D.B. made me invest, I swear.

item.name: Devil Bunny Needs a Ham
item.comment: This gets points only for the title and the absurdist humor. I still don't known why he needs the ham, But I like his solution.

item.name: Diamonds
item.comment:
A fun Hearts varient where there are special rules for each suit, rewards playing off suit and a special catch up for a player that wins no tricks.
Very cool
item.wishlistcomment: Played pre-print copy at DexCon 17. Wonderfully fun.

item.name: Dice Age Alpha Edition
item.originalname: Dice Age Alpha Edition: Fundamental series
item.comment:
pre-ordered both sets 2/28/12
Just past the one year mark and no delivery date in site...fools and money as they say...
Two years now...Fuck You Tristan Convert

item.name: Dice Age, Proxy Edition
item.comment:
Chaotic fun with bizarre die types. The rules seem fuzzy already, but the designer is engaging and helpful. I loook forward to the release of the Alpha set, but in the meantime I think picking up a set of the Proxy set is a great idea.
Just looking at them does not do the designer justice, hold them, roll them; only then will you start to understand just how far the rabbit hole goes...
Played it 2/10/12 at Time Warp Comics, Cedar Grove, NJ with the designer.
Pre-ordered a couple of sets - 2/28/12
Set #71 is mine!!! - 3/15/12 (Ides of March)
Update: it is increasingly unlikely I will ever receive what I paid for, or a refund. Disappointing. 4/6/13
Tristan Convert, go fuck yourself 12/23/15

item.name: Dice Brewing
item.comment:
A dice game with the fun brewed out of it...terrible tedious gameplay no tension, interesting decisions and zero fun.
Does not improve with actual beer.

item.name: Diceland: Deep White Sea
item.comment: the most chaotic, violent and physical game I have ever played. we end up shooting dice over the shoulder, from the tops of chairs, and screaming at each other a lot. Good Times indeed!

item.name: Diceland: Extra Space
item.comment: Why did I get this? 'cause it was cheap and fun to throw. If you played it you understand the hilarity all too well.

item.name: Diceland: Ogre
item.comment:
ok I admit, I bought it and it stunk. And yes I actually bought it twice.
In the end they made great cat toys when filled with catnip.

item.name: Diceland: Space
item.comment:
not as much fun as Deep White Sea...
I gave to a friend so I could regain storage space, he loves it. good for him.

item.name: Diceland: Space
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dirtside II
item.comment: good source for developing house rules for other 1:300 scale games, but not enough by itself to keep me interested.

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment:
Very high level of chaos and screwage in a simple area majority game. Hidden victory conditions lead to wariness and funny game plays. The art is awesome and the card play is smooth. Easy to learn, and a challenge to win.
Great game!
Extra points for the lovely gaming pieces contained in the deluxe edition.
item.wishlistcomment: Really holding onto hope for the Deluxe Collector's edition

item.name: Disorder
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
Disposed? Recycling as therapy against hoarding games.

item.name: Divided Republic
item.comment:
Received in trade for an extra copy of Discworld: Ankh-Morpork...can't wait to play!
Well, color me unhappy...the quality is great, the theme is fascinating and resonates, but chaos is king with little potential for strategy (IMO). You need to react tactically at each moment knowing that powerful event cards can undo several actions in an instant. I wish that the game would have some pace or constriction with required or mandatory events, but it does not.
item.wishlistcomment: Hoping for a great game, no idea what will come of it, but very interested. this one I shoulda "kickstarted"

item.name: Dixit
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
Great family game where imagination is king, the board in the box is wonderful as are the bunny meeples racing in the flower patch.

item.name: Dixit Odyssey
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
Build upon the original and best of all it comes ready to store everything that came before it.
Wonderful

item.name: Doctor Who: The Card Game
item.comment:
Kayleigh's
it's got a drafting, pass n play mechanism that is wholly unthematic and terminally irritating. fun to look at dreadfully dull to play.
watch TV and play Brass instead, you deserved better Doctor.

item.name: Dogfight
item.comment: I played this happily for years as a kid...probably what got me into Wings of War. I loved the graphics of the board and unit cards. Nostalgia keeps me interested in getting a collectors quality copy.

item.name: Dominant Species
item.comment: tedious worker placement gameplay with 6 players. might be entertaining with 4, but lots of downtime and a bunch of "moving parts".

item.name: Dominant Species: The Card Game
item.comment:
It's not short in duration, it is dull as dirt, and there is no theme, just boring mechanics, uneven events and nonsense scoring.
Dominant Species is a better game, but neither appeals to me...I'll be fine without both.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
After several plays, this is becoming the pick-up game of request. so easy to learn and fast. the variability keeps each round fresh and the card combos are great fun to trigger.
Haven't met a player who wasn't impressed yet!
Unfortunately after people started playing this online nobody wants to play face to face and the game lost it's place at our table.

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: great game that was eclipsed by online play, nobody wants to play in person, shameful.

item.name: Dominoes
item.comment: a versitle toy/game/pastime, so many uses

item.name: Don't Break the Ice
item.comment:
great fun toc toc tocking blocks waiting for that dick in the center to fall through and celebrate his demise...hmm maybe I was not playing this right?
Sometimes we played top collapse the board in one hit.
I liked that version.

item.name: Don't Spill the Beans
item.comment:
Yeah, I played this a lot and I've spilled the beans plenty of times...I also learned to ride a bike, masturbate and do my taxes.
for a significantly more entertaining update look for Bamboleo

item.name: Donburiko
item.comment:
Fun micro game that is very mathy with a short learning curve. I think that it might fade quickly as it seems to be very easy to mess up other players with hidden plays.
Great design regardless of its longevity

item.name: Doomtrooper
item.comment: i once collected 15 lbs of this shit. I know that because I shipped it all to some fool on ebay that wanted them.

item.name: Dork Frag
item.comment: Dumb and pointless expansion for a forgettable game.

item.name: Dork Tower
item.comment:
I bought it and it was not worth the cost, the minis were fun to paint regardless.
not even a mediocre experience.

item.name: Double Trouble
item.comment: Pop-O-Matic! groovy plastic and pawns swarm around a sealed die roller popper. I loved this shit.

item.name: The Downfall of Pompeii
item.comment: mean family entertainment, the volcano is an inspired bit of chrome

item.name: Dr. Seuss Green Eggs and Ham Game
item.comment: A game in my daughter's childhood collection, utterly awful

item.name: Draco Mundis
item.comment:
A mediocre game of "kick the can" that carries none of the excitement of that childhood favorite.
Blah...

item.name: Dragon Master
item.comment: Free game with BGG.registration

item.name: Dragon Rage
item.comment:
I have no idea why I have kept this...nostalgia I guess.
went to a good home...

item.name: Dragster
item.comment: Wacky gimmick game with marble-like racecars, is was fun back when I was 10

item.name: Dreidel
item.comment: Cultural artifact, yes. Entertaining game, no.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: I own the 2nd edition, due to merged items my rating is here

item.name: Duel in the Dark: Second Edition
item.comment: Great looking game that was a bargain stuffed full of expansions.

item.name: Duel of Ages Set 1: Worldspanner
item.comment: the art is attrocious, the board components are warped and do not fit together.The rulebook is rather funny, but the game sucks. I mean it really does suck.

item.name: The Duke
item.comment:
Easy to learn with the moves printed on each tile. It takes some effort at first to remember both side of each tile you play, but it ramps up gently.
A fun low stress chess variant that is well worth playing many times.

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: Dungeon Keeper as a board game...the mechanics and theme are excellent. worth playing at the drop of a hat

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment: Another game I never seem to get a chance with

item.name: Dungeon Run
item.comment:
Dull mess with an unispired theme. With only 2 actions you either spread out to develop your hero or watch others profit from your efforts only to die easily if you are the first moron to touch the summoning stone.
The players have no incentive to engage the boss except to end the game.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: This game is straight-up fun with easy rules, tons of depth and no dice! What little randomness it possess just adds to the challenge. It was an instant hit on game night.

item.name: Dungeon!
item.comment: a intro to dungeon crawling without being an RPG...eventually stop playing, then you win

item.name: Dungeoneer: Den of the Wererats
item.comment: This just never got any better...gave the entire set and the Lunchbox to a friend.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Dragons of the Forsaken Desert
item.comment: More tedious and unforgivably boring adveturing. Such a shame as I really liked the original idea.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Haunted Woods of Malthorin
item.comment: the game drags on and multi-players just makes it worse. I was hoping for a good dungeon crawl, this is not it.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
item.comment: the game drags on and multi-players just makes it worse. I was hoping for a good dungeon crawl, this is not it.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Vault of the Fiends
item.comment:
the game drags on and multi-players just makes it worse. I was hoping for a good dungeon crawl, this is not it.
I got the lunchbox case...I like it more than the game...that makes me sad.

item.name: DungeonQuest
item.comment:
This game was interesting for 2 turns and nosedived irrevocably as everyone died and the owner said "Wasn't that the coolest?"
No, it wasn't. Hard games are rewarding by virtue of the possibility of beating them, as are skilled opponents. Games that rely on random effects that are disconnected from choices made by the player are pointless time wasters.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment: very cool game that opens the door on D & D combat mechanics. fun solo and in groups, minis are awesome

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
item.comment: not a bad game for a conquest theme, rewards naked aggression. You will find the team mode entertaining. I personally would not want to play through a "winner take all session", I prefer the short/medium game victory conditions.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
item.comment: Blends well with Castle Ravenloft; excellent value.

item.name: Dust
item.comment: The more I play it, the better the game gets. The theme may be thin as tissue paper, but the strategy, the offensive nature of the turns and the challenge of the initiative bidding are all parts that make the game excellent!

item.name: DVONN
item.comment: Another solid design that demands repeat plays. GIPF reigns!

item.name: Eaten by Zombies!
item.comment: mildly ammusing deck-builder that gets old very quickly...the game devolves very quickly as someone gets draw combos that make their turn drag unforgivably.

item.name: Ebola Monkey Hunt
item.comment:
Part of the Cheapass wave, with a funny title and retarded gameplay...of course I bought it!
Stupid game, made me pine for and repurchase my Metagaming collection.

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment:
My Twilight Imperium, blissfully shorter. The game plays smoothly, has lots of choices and strategies if slightly less interactive beyond the obvious dice rolling. I see a lot of plays in the future once the naysayers actually play it...
Wrong! This game always ends with a rush to the center for one climatic battle that renders all your planning moot.
Dice win

item.name: Eggs of Ostrich
item.comment:
A fun 3 player, with unfortunately creepy graphics (can an ostrich lay on its back, legs akimbo? Don't answer that, please!)
The scoring makes you risk losing everything as you score near nothing for anything less than a full bag.
Once you start losing bags your options fall away precipitously.

item.name: Eight-Minute Empire
item.comment:
Short, but very much in the tradition of other area control games. That being said I would rather play most of those other area control games, and for a filler game there are many choices I would make to play.
It's not awful, but it is very limited for a tactics only game.

item.name: Elk Fest
item.comment: Light dexterity game with simple rules. Cute but dull exercise in controlling your flicking. Worth a few laughs and repeat evenings

item.name: Empire Engine
item.comment: Ok micro game with a bit of guts and strategy. Not bad especially for the price, but I'm glad someone else bought it.

item.name: Empires of the Ancient World
item.comment: another early bright spot in wallace's designs.

item.name: En Garde
item.comment: Great game that is entirely a math exercise...until you put your fencer on the board. Sublime mix of theme and design that is a perfect filler.

item.name: End of Atlantis: Revised Edition
item.comment:
A very pretty game that I would risk as buy...(nothing but auctions?)
But good luck finding a copy in the U.S. I'm not gonna bother trying
item.wishlistcomment: Seriously pretty!

item.name: The End of the Triumvirate
item.comment: an excellent 3-player design, very well balanced and clever. theme is blended seemlessly. Awersome.

item.name: Entdecker
item.comment: Notable tile laying game from the early days of the modern boardgame, Goldsiber was a giant of quality

item.name: Entdecker: Exploring New Horizons
item.comment: Revised entdecker...I bought it just because

item.name: Enter the Passage
item.comment:
Came with Made for Play DVD produced by the Spiel
A werewolf adaptation of a novel I have not read...the kind of thing you throw in a box to promote a creative property, not something anyone would ever play.

item.name: Epic Armageddon
item.comment:
the best large scale minatures wargame ever.
as with everything GW they have not met a game they cannot kill.

item.name: Epigo
item.comment:
Received at BBG.con 2012
Donated to my FLGS

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: Chaotic and entertaining for a group game, not something I could see myself playing often. Like all audio cue games you need to have ambient conditions that allow you to hear the soundtrack clearly.

item.name: Espa√±a 1936
item.comment: I keep coming back to this, so many mixed reactions...need to inform my own opinion.

item.name: Espa√±a 20
item.comment: New stand-alone battle, no mounted map :(
